examples: The media speculated about the celebrity couple's relationship status, wondering if they were an item or just good friends.
The tabloids love to speculate about celebrities who might be in bed with each other.
The author took a chance by writing a book on an unconventional topic, but she knew that if you do not speculate, you cannot accumulate.
Researchers can only speculate.
Some people even speculated that the Mothman was sent by cornstalk himself from beyond the grave.
words.defineEn: to form a theory or opinion about a subject without knowing all the facts
words.defineVi: để hình thành một lý thuyết hoặc ý kiến về một chủ đề mà không cần biết tất cả các sự kiện

examples: After all, speculators face the danger that the item is already overpriced.
An investor does not own GameStop, a speculator owns GameStop.
Let's not confuse speculators with investors.
Since most speculators are nervous about where they invest their money, bubbles are by no means the norm.
And they were particularly worried about bankers, merchants and speculators, who seemed to be getting rich without actually producing anything.
words.defineEn: someone who risks losses for the possibility of considerable gains
words.defineVi: một người có nguy cơ thua lỗ vì khả năng thu được lợi nhuận đáng kể

examples: The belief in homeopathy correlates with skepticism about vaccinations.
In this case, the shape of each kind of epithelial cell correlates with its function.
They're negatively correlated.
A record of purchases can be strongly correlated to gender.
And anxiety is essentially correlated with uncertainty.
words.defineEn: to be closely connected or have mutual effects
words.defineVi: được kết nối chặt chẽ hoặc có tác động lẫn nhau

examples: So the study does show a correlation.
Remember, correlation does not equal causation.
Hence the common refrain: correlation doesn’t imply causation.
Some epidemiological research suggests a correlation between certain BCG vaccination programs and lower rates of severe COVID-19 cases.
Studies have found negative correlations between FOMO and psychological needs satisfaction.
words.defineEn: a mutual connection or relation between two or more things
words.defineVi: một kết nối lẫn nhau hoặc mối quan hệ giữa hai hoặc nhiều điều

words.defineEn: expressing a reciprocal or complementary relation
words.defineVi: thể hiện một mối quan hệ tương hỗ hoặc bổ sung

examples: Baldur’s brother Hodur, who was blind and weapon-less, sat dejected.
words.defineVi: hạ thấp tinh thần của ai đó; làm nản lòng

examples: I deserve this emotional dejection that I'm currently experiencing.
But it's, like, emotional dejection and realizing you know that you deserve it.
words.defineVi: một trạng thái trầm cảm u sầu

examples: And we basically embellished our lives.
These stories may be embellished and depict Sparta at the apex of its power, so take them with a grain of salt.
Vasari made errors and loved to embellish stories.
But I cannot think of a single public institution that is strengthened, embellished, enhanced by this administration, where public trust, public confidence has been increased.
For instance, these $3,595 Louboutins are embellished with Swarovski Crystals.

words.defineEn: care or worry for a person's well-being
words.defineVi: quan tâm hoặc lo lắng cho hạnh phúc của một người

examples: And the current administration is no different, although they seem, to me, to be extra solicitous of Russia generally, and Putin specifically, in ways I don’t exactly understand.
words.defineVi: thể hiện sự chú ý lơ lửng

examples: And Mr. Trump still doesn’t, in my view, understand the solemn, the sacred obligations of being president of the United States.
The gods sealed the deal with solemn oaths and swore the mason would come to no harm in Asgard.
I've entered into solemn covenants with the wives that I have.
Kenyans, for example, swore solemn oaths to fight for freedom and in doing so became part of the Land and Freedom Army or Mau Mau movement.
And finally, a president bears no greater decision and no more solemn burden than serving as Commander-in-Chief of the greatest military that the world has ever known.
words.defineEn: dignified and somber in manner or character and committed to keeping promises
words.defineVi: trang nghiêm và ảm đạm trong cách thức hoặc tính cách và cam kết giữ lời hứa

examples: Evidence comes from three fields: archaeology, pollen analysis, and paleontology.
From space to archaeology, it’ll help you see the year in a whole new light.
That means, this method could answer some of the biggest questions in paleontology, archaeology, and anthropology.
It's a problem that goes way beyond archaeology.
It's a problem that goes way beyond archaeology.
words.defineEn: the scientific study of ancient societies through examining the remains of their monuments, graves, tools, corpses, etc., some of which are found deep in the ground
words.defineVi: nghiên cứu khoa học về các xã hội cổ đại thông qua việc kiểm tra phần còn lại của di tích, ngôi mộ, công cụ, xác chết, v.v., một số được tìm thấy sâu trong lòng đất

examples: And nothing was so irritating as the confident way he used archaic idiom.
His stuff seems archaic NOW!
We know anatomically modern humans arose from archaic humans like Homo erectus in Africa.
It was really archaic, I am so glad they're coming into the 21st century.
Because we’ve sequenced the Neanderthal genome from fossils, we already know about a bunch of gene variants that we’ve inherited from our archaic cousins.
words.defineEn: dating back to the ancient past
words.defineVi: hẹn hò với quá khứ xa xưa

examples: PAUL SOLMAN: Charlotte Lucas' lot wasn't the happiest, but better than penury, one imagines.
words.defineEn: a state of extreme poverty or destitution
words.defineVi: một tình trạng cực kỳ nghèo đói hoặc cơ cực

words.defineEn: having an extreme lack of money

examples: Nikola rebutted the fraud claims, saying that there were dozens of inaccurate allegations in the report.
Trump rebutted, and he wants it to be a stolen election party.
And to rebut that comment, I've drawn the phase diagram for carbon dioxide.
It is anything we can do to rebut it.
How did Gallagher's team rebut those witnesses?
words.defineEn: overthrow by argument, evidence, or proof
words.defineVi: lật đổ bằng lập luận, bằng chứng hoặc bằng chứng

examples: The prosecution returned with a brief rebuttal.
So that was a pretty powerful rebuttal.
As Brooke spoke, Hillary quickly drafted an unplanned rebuttal to the Massachusetts senator.
Rare testimony from Democratic Senate Leader Chuck Schumer, followed by equally rare committee rebuttal by Republican Senate Leader Mitch McConnell.
I thought she was a really interesting choice to do the rebuttal.
words.defineEn: the speech act of refuting by offering a contrary contention or argument
words.defineVi: hành động nói bác bỏ bằng cách đưa ra một tranh luận hoặc lập luận trái ngược

examples: People were tempted into the trade by the thought of easy money.
It's true what they say - an open door may tempt a saint.
One of my colleagues was rude to me in a meeting, and I was tempted to snap back.
Sadly, new customers are being enticed by tempting promotions only to find the dice are loaded against them.
Sarah's family was tempted to take out a loan to go on a lavish vacation, but they remembered the saying 'better go to bed supperless than rise in debt.'
words.defineEn: to feel the desire to do something
words.defineVi: để cảm thấy mong muốn để làm một cái gì đó
một người cám dỗ người khác
